info.title: Reports Marketing Mailchimp
info.description: Mailchimp helps small businesses do big things, with the right tools and guidance every step of the way.

get.description: Get campaign reports.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The campaign type.

parameters.name: before_send_time
parameters.description: Restrict the response to campaigns sent before the set time. We recommend [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

parameters.name: since_send_time
parameters.description: Restrict the response to campaigns sent after the set time. We recommend [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

schema.title: Campaign Reports
schema.description: A list of reports containing campaigns marked as Sent.

items.title: Campaign Report
items.description: Report details about a sent campaign.

id.title: Campaign ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this campaign.

type.title: Campaign Type
type.description: The type of campaign (regular, plain-text, ab_split, rss, automation, variate, or auto).

list_is_active.title: List Status
list_is_active.description: The status of the list used, namely if it's deleted or disabled.

subject_line.title: Campaign Subject Line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

preview_text.title: Campaign Preview Text
preview_text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.

abuse_reports.title: Abuse Reports
abuse_reports.description: The number of abuse reports generated for this campaign.

unsubscribed.title: Unsubscribe Count
unsubscribed.description: The total number of unsubscribed members for this campaign.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: The date and time a campaign was sent in ISO 8601 format.

rss_last_send.title: RSS Last Send
rss_last_send.description: For RSS campaigns, the date and time of the last send in ISO 8601 format.

bounces.title: Bounces
bounces.description: An object describing the bounce summary for the campaign.

hard_bounces.title: Hard Bounces
hard_bounces.description: The total number of hard bounced email addresses.

soft_bounces.title: Soft Bounces
soft_bounces.description: The total number of soft bounced email addresses.

syntax_errors.title: Syntax Errors
syntax_errors.description: The total number of addresses that were syntax-related bounces.

forwards.title: Forwards
forwards.description: An object describing the forwards and forward activity for the campaign.

forwards_count.title: Total Forwards
forwards_count.description: How many times the campaign has been forwarded.

forwards_opens.title: Forward Opens
forwards_opens.description: How many times the forwarded campaign has been opened.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: An object describing the open activity for the campaign.

opens_total.title: Total Opens
opens_total.description: The total number of opens for a campaign.

unique_opens.title: Unique Opens
unique_opens.description: The total number of unique opens.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

last_open.title: Last Open
last_open.description: The date and time of the last recorded open in ISO 8601 format.

clicks.title: Clicks
clicks.description: An object describing the click activity for the campaign.

clicks_total.title: Total Clicks
clicks_total.description: The total number of clicks for the campaign.

unique_clicks.title: Unique Clicks
unique_clicks.description: The total number of unique clicks for links across a campaign.

unique_subscriber_clicks.title: Unique Subscriber Clicks
unique_subscriber_clicks.description: The total number of subscribers who clicked on a campaign.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

last_click.title: Last Click
last_click.description: The date and time of the last recorded click for the campaign in ISO 8601 format.

facebook_likes.title: Facebook Likes
facebook_likes.description: An object describing campaign engagement on Facebook.

recipient_likes.title: Recipient Likes
recipient_likes.description: The number of recipients who liked the campaign on Facebook.

facebook_likes.title: Facebook Likes
facebook_likes.description: The number of Facebook likes for the campaign.

industry_stats.title: Industry Stats
industry_stats.description: The average campaign statistics for your industry.

type.title: Industry Type
type.description: The type of business industry associated with your account. For example: retail, education, etc.

list_stats.title: List Stats
list_stats.description: The average campaign statistics for your list. This won't be present if we haven't calculated it yet for this list.

sub_rate.title: Average Subscription Rate
sub_rate.description: The average number of subscriptions per month for the list.

unsub_rate.title: Average Unsubscription Rate
unsub_rate.description: The average number of unsubscriptions per month for the list.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The average open rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The average click rate (a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list.

ab_split.title: A/B Split Stats
ab_split.description: General stats about different groups of an A/B Split campaign. Does not return information about [Mailchimp Pro's Multivariate Campaigns](https://mailchimp.com/help/about-multivariate-campaigns/).

forwards_opens.title: Forward Opens
forwards_opens.description: Opens from forwards for Campaign A.

last_open.title: Last Open
last_open.description: The last open for Campaign A.

forwards_opens.title: Forward Opens
forwards_opens.description: Opens for forwards from Campaign B.

last_open.title: Last Open
last_open.description: The last open for Campaign B.

timewarp.title: Timewarp Stats
timewarp.description: An hourly breakdown of sends, opens, and clicks if a campaign is sent using timewarp.

gmt_offset.title: GMT Offset
gmt_offset.description: For campaigns sent with timewarp, the time zone group the member is apart of.

last_open.title: Last Open
last_open.description: The date and time of the last open in ISO 8601 format.

clicks.title: Clicks
clicks.description: The number of clicks.

last_click.title: Last Click
last_click.description: The date and time of the last click in ISO 8601 format.

timeseries.title: Timeseries
timeseries.description: An hourly breakdown of the performance of the campaign over the first 24 hours.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The date and time for the series in ISO 8601 format.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The number of emails sent in the timeseries.

unique_opens.title: Unique Opens
unique_opens.description: The number of unique opens in the timeseries.

recipients_clicks.title: Recipient Clicks
recipients_clicks.description: The number of clicks in the timeseries.

share_report.title: Share Report
share_report.description: The url and password for the [VIP report](https://mailchimp.com/help/share-a-campaign-report/).

share_url.title: Report URL
share_url.description: The URL for the VIP report.

share_password.title: Report Password
share_password.description: If password protected, the password for the VIP report.

total_orders.title: Total Orders
total_orders.description: The total orders for a campaign.

total_spent.title: Total Spent
total_spent.description: The total spent for a campaign. Calculated as the sum of all order totals with no deductions.

total_revenue.title: Total Revenue
total_revenue.description: The total revenue for a campaign. Calculated as the sum of all order totals minus shipping and tax totals.

currency_code.title: Three letter currency code for this user

delivery_status.title: Campaign Delivery Status
delivery_status.description: Updates on campaigns in the process of sending.

enabled.title: Delivery Status Enabled
enabled.description: Whether Campaign Delivery Status is enabled for this account and campaign.

can_cancel.title: Campaign Cancelable
can_cancel.description: Whether a campaign send can be canceled.

status.title: Campaign Delivery Status
status.description: The current state of a campaign delivery.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails confirmed sent for this campaign so far.

emails_canceled.title: Emails Canceled
emails_canceled.description: The total number of emails canceled for this campaign.

_links.title: Links
_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

items.title: Resource Link
items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.

href.title: Href
href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'.

targetSchema.title: Target Schema
targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.

reports.title: Lists
reports.description: An array of objects, each representing a report resource.

total_items.title: Item Count
total_items.description: The total number of items matching the query regardless of pagination.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

get.description: Get information about clicks on specific links in your Mailchimp campaigns.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: campaign_id

email_id.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address.

merge_fields.description: An individual merge var and value for a member.

additionalProperties.description: This object's keys are merge tags (like FNAME). It's values are the values to be added to the merge field.

clicks.description: The total number of times the subscriber clicked on the link.

url_id.description: The id for the tracked URL in the campaign.

list_is_active.description: The status of the list used, namely if it's deleted or disabled.

contact_status.description: The status of the member, namely if they are subscribed, unsubscribed, deleted, non-subscribed, transactional, pending, or need reconfirmation.

get.description: Get detailed information about any campaign emails that were opened by a list member.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The unique id for the campaign.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Restrict results to campaign open events that occur after a specific time. We recommend [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

schema.title: Open Detail Report
schema.description: A detailed report of any campaign emails that were opened by a list member.

items.title: Open Activity
items.description: A list of a member's opens activity in a specific campaign.

campaign_id.description: The unique id for the campaign.

list_id.title: List ID
list_id.description: The unique id for the list.

list_is_active.title: List Status

email_id.title: Email Hash

merge_fields.description: An individual merge var and value for a member.

opens_count.title: Opens count
opens_count.description: The total number of times the this campaign was opened by the list member.

opens.title: Time series data of opens activity
opens.description: An array of timestamps for each time a list member opened the campaign. If a list member opens an email multiple times, this will return a separate timestamp for each open event.

items.title: Member Activity
items.description: A summary of the interaction with the campaign.

domain.description: The name of the domain (gmail.com, hotmail.com, yahoo.com).

delivered.description: The number of successful deliveries for a domain.

get.description: Get a list of member's subscriber activity in a specific campaign.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The unique id for the campaign.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Restrict results to email activity events that occur after a specific time. We recommend [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

url.description: If the action is a 'click', the URL on which the member clicked.

activity.description: An array of objects, each showing an interaction with the email.

items.title: Member Activity
items.description: A summary of the interaction with the campaign.

action.title: Action
action.description: One of the following actions: 'open', 'click', or 'bounce'

type.title: Type
type.description: If the action is a 'bounce', the type of bounce received: 'hard', 'soft'.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The date and time recorded for the action in ISO 8601 format.

url.title: URL
url.description: If the action is a 'click', the URL on which the member clicked.

ip.title: IP
ip.description: The IP address recorded for the action.

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.description: The unique id for the campaign.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

schema.title: Open Locations

region.title: Region
region.description: An internal code for the region representing the more specific location area such as city or state. When this is blank, it indicates we know the country, but not the region.

region_name.title: Region Name
region_name.description: The name of the region, if we have one. For blank "region" values, this will be "Rest of Country".

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: The number of unique campaign opens for a region.

locations.title: Lists
locations.description: An array of objects, each representing a top location for opens.

total_items.title: Item Count
total_items.description: The total number of items matching the query regardless of pagination.

get.description: Get a list of reports with child campaigns for a specific parent campaign.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The unique id for the campaign.

schema.title: Campaign Sub-Reports
schema.description: A list of reports containing child campaigns for a specific campaign.

items.title: Campaign Report
items.description: Report details about a sent campaign.

id.title: Campaign ID
id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this campaign.

type.title: Campaign Type
type.description: The type of campaign (regular, plain-text, ab_split, rss, automation, variate, or auto).

list_is_active.title: List Status
list_is_active.description: The status of the list used, namely if it's deleted or disabled.

subject_line.title: Campaign Subject Line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

preview_text.title: Campaign Preview Text
preview_text.description: The preview text for the campaign.

emails_sent.title: Emails Sent
emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign.

abuse_reports.title: Abuse Reports
abuse_reports.description: The number of abuse reports generated for this campaign.

unsubscribed.title: Unsubscribe Count
unsubscribed.description: The total number of unsubscribed members for this campaign.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: The date and time a campaign was sent in ISO 8601 format.

rss_last_send.title: RSS Last Send
rss_last_send.description: For RSS campaigns, the date and time of the last send in ISO 8601 format.

bounces.title: Bounces
bounces.description: An object describing the bounce summary for the campaign.

hard_bounces.title: Hard Bounces
hard_bounces.description: The total number of hard bounced email addresses.

soft_bounces.title: Soft Bounces
soft_bounces.description: The total number of soft bounced email addresses.

syntax_errors.title: Syntax Errors
syntax_errors.description: The total number of addresses that were syntax-related bounces.

forwards.title: Forwards
forwards.description: An object describing the forwards and forward activity for the campaign.

forwards_count.title: Total Forwards
forwards_count.description: How many times the campaign has been forwarded.

forwards_opens.title: Forward Opens
forwards_opens.description: How many times the forwarded campaign has been opened.

opens.title: Opens
opens.description: An object describing the open activity for the campaign.

opens_total.title: Total Opens
opens_total.description: The total number of opens for a campaign.

unique_opens.title: Unique Opens
unique_opens.description: The total number of unique opens.

open_rate.title: Open Rate
open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

last_open.title: Last Open
last_open.description: The date and time of the last recorded open in ISO 8601 format.

clicks.title: Clicks
clicks.description: An object describing the click activity for the campaign.

clicks_total.title: Total Clicks
clicks_total.description: The total number of clicks for the campaign.

unique_clicks.title: Unique Clicks
unique_clicks.description: The total number of unique clicks for links across a campaign.

unique_subscriber_clicks.title: Unique Subscriber Clicks
unique_subscriber_clicks.description: The total number of subscribers who clicked on a campaign.

click_rate.title: Click Rate
click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks divided by the total number of successful deliveries.

last_click.title: Last Click

additionalProperties.description: This object's keys are merge tags (like FNAME). It's values are the values to be added to the merge field.

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: The date and time the member opted-out in ISO 8601 format.

reason.title: Unsubscribe Reason
reason.description: If available, the reason listed by the member for unsubscribing.

list_is_active.title: List Status
list_is_active.description: The status of the list used, namely if it's deleted or disabled.

_links.title: Links
_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

items.title: Resource Link
items.description: This object represents a link from the resource where it is found to another resource or action that may be performed.

rel.title: Rel
rel.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.

href.title: Href
href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.

method.title: Method
method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'.

targetSchema.title: Target Schema
targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.

default.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API.

schema.title: Problem Detail Document
schema.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

type.title: Problem Type
type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.

title.title: Error Title
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

status.title: HTTP Status Code
status.description: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.title: Error Message
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.title: Instance ID
instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

get.description: Get breakdown of product activity for a campaign

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of records to return. [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **10**. [Maximum value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **1000**

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of records from a collection to skip. Iterating over large collections with this parameter can be slow.  [Default value](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Parameters) is **0**.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The unique id for the campaign.

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Returns files sorted by the specified field.
